crown.name: CSK_LiveConnect
crown.desc: This module provides the possibility to communicate via the SICK Industrial Cloud Connection (ICC) with a digital device (digital twin) configured in the SICK AssetHub to make local processed data securely available for cloud services. + For further information about this approach in general please check https://integrationspace.sick.com/. + {empty} + Before data can be exchanged, the physical gateway device must first be paired with the digital twin in the SICK AssetHub. + After the pairing process, profiles can be made known to the gateway device itself, or an attached device (peerDevice). + {empty} + There are two types of profiles that can be used: + {empty} + *1) MQTT profiles* + - The device automatically sends data into the cloud (data push) + - Profile description "asyncAPI" + {empty} + Typically this profile can be used like this (check also main script of this module regarding sample code): + {empty} + 1.1) Create MQTT profile via CSK_LiveConnect.MQTTProfile.create() + 1.2) Set all relevant parameters of this profle (check 'set...' functions of 'CSK_LiveConnect.MQTTProfile'). + 1.3) Register application profile via 'CSK_LiveConnect.addMQTTProfile'. + 1.4) Push JSON payload via 'CSK_LiveConnect.publishMQTTData'. + {empty} + *2) HTTP profiles* + - HTTP requests can be sent from the cloud side (data poll), which are answered by the device on the shop floor side. + - Profile description "openAPI" + {empty} + Typically this profile can be used like this (check also main script of this module regarding sample code): + {empty} + 2.1.1) Create a HTTPProfile via 'CSK_LiveConnect.HTTPProfile.create' and set its parameters via its 'CSK_LiveConnect.HTTPProfile.set...' functions. + 2.1.2) Create an endpoint via 'CSK_LiveConnect.HTTPProfile.Endpoint.create' and configure its values via its 'CSK_LiveConnect.HTTPProfile.Endpoint.set...' functions. + 2.1.3) Serve an individual function to be triggered via remote with a 'CSK_LiveConnect.Request' as input parameter and a 'CSK_LiveConnect.Response' as return value. E.g. via: + 'Script.serveFunction('[AppName].[UriName]', httpCallbackFunction, "object:CSK_LiveConnect.Request", "object:CSK_LiveConnect.Response")'. + 2.1.4) Add the endpoints via 'CSK_LiveConnect.HTTPProfile.setEndpoints'. + 2.1.5) Add the HTTP profile via 'CSK_LiveConnect.addHTTPProfile'. + {empty} + 2.2) To respond now on HTTP requests it can be done like this: + 2.2.1) Create a response via 'CSK_LiveConnect.Response.create' and header via 'CSK_LiveConnect.Header.create'. + 2.2.2) Set key and value of the header via 'CSK_LiveConnect.Header.setKey' / 'CSK_LiveConnect.Header.setValue'. + 2.2.3) Set header and status code of the response via 'CSK_LiveConnect.Response.setHeaders' / 'CSK_LiveConnect.Response.setStatusCode'. + 2.2.4) Set response content via ''CSK_LiveConnect.Response.setContent' and return the CSK_LiveConnect.Response object. + {empty} + The payload is defined in the profile. The format is JSON.

event.name: OnNewStatusLoadParameterOnReboot
event.desc: Notify status if parameters should be loaded on app/device boot up.

event.name: OnPersistentDataModuleAvailable
event.desc: Notify status if features of CSK_PersistentData module are available.

event.name: OnDataLoadedOnReboot
event.desc: Event to call if module tried to load parameters and should be ready.

event.name: OnNewParameterName
event.desc: Notify name of persistent data parameter.

event.name: OnUserLevelOperatorActive
event.desc: Status of Operator userlevel. Used internally in combination with the CSK_UserManagement module if available.

event.name: OnUserLevelMaintenanceActive
event.desc: Status of Maintenance userlevel. Used internally in combination with the CSK_UserManagement module if available.

event.name: OnUserLevelServiceActive
event.desc: Status of Service userlevel. Used internally in combination with the CSK_UserManagement module if available.

event.name: OnUserLevelAdminActive
event.desc: Status of Admin userlevel. Used internally in combination with the CSK_UserManagement module if available.

event.name: OnClientInitialized
event.desc: Event called when the LiveConnect client has been initialised.

event.name: OnNewProfileAdded
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as a new profile was added.

event.name: OnNewMQTTKeepAliveInterval
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the MQTT keep alive interval has been changed.

event.name: OnNewMQTTConnectTimeout
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the MQTT connect timeout has been changed.

event.name: OnNewMQTTMessageInterval
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the MQTT message interval has been changed.

event.name: OnNewMQTTQueueSize
event.desc: If the LiveConnect connection is broken, the data is stored in the queue. + When the queue is full, the oldest data is discarded automatically. + This event is triggered as soon as the MQTT queue size has been changed.

event.name: OnNewGatewayPartNumber
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the part number of the gateway device has been changed.

param.desc: Part number of the gateway device.
param.name: partNumber

event.name: OnNewGatewaySerialNumber
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the serial number of the gateway device has been changed.

param.desc: Serial number of the gateway device.
param.name: serialNumber

event.name: OnNewProcessInterval
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the Process interval has been changed.

event.name: OnNewTokenTimeout
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the token timeout has been changed.

event.name: OnNewDeviceDiscoveryTimeout
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the device discovery timeout has been changed.

event.name: OnNewCloudSystem
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the cloud system has been changed.

event.name: OnNewValidateTokenResult
event.desc: This event is triggered as soon as the validate token result has been changed.

event.name: OnNewStatusConnectionStatus
event.desc: Notify LiveConnect connection status.

param.desc: Connection status. + - Offline + - Online + - Execute command + - Discover devices + - Waiting for token validationtion
param.name: status

event.name: OnNewStatusDeviceURL
event.desc: Notify device URL which refers to the digital twin on the SICK AssetHub.

param.desc: URL which refers to the digital twin on the SICK AssetHub.
param.name: url

function.name: setParameterName
function.desc: Function to set the name of the parameters if saved/loaded via the CSK_PersistentData module.

function.name: sendParameters
function.desc: Send parameters to CSK_PersistentData module if possible to save them.

function.name: loadParameters
function.desc: Load parameters for this module from the PersistentData CSK-module if possible and use them

function.name: setLoadOnReboot
function.desc: Configure if this module should load its saved parameters at app/device boot up.

function.name: pageCalled
function.desc: Function to register "OnResume" of the module UI (only as helper function).

return.desc: Empty string (only needed to simplify binding).
return.name: empty

function.name: publishMQTTData
function.desc: Publish MQTT data to the cloud using a part- and serial number of the device in the AssetHub.

param.desc: MQTT topic where the data should be published to. + The topics are defined in the device profile.
param.name: topic

param.desc: Part number of the device in the AssetHub to which the data is to be sent.
param.name: partNumber

param.desc: Serial number of the device in the AssetHub to which the data is to be sent.
param.name: serialNumber

param.desc: JSON based payload to be published. + The payload is defined in the MQTT profile.
param.name: payload

function.name: addMQTTProfile
function.desc: Add a new MQTT profile to new or an already exiting device.

param.desc: Part number of the device that should be assigned to the profile.
param.name: partNumber

param.desc: Serial number of the device that should be assigned to the profile.
param.name: serialNumber

param.desc: MQTT profile designed as a crown datatype.
param.name: profile

function.name: removePeerDevice
function.desc: Removes a peer device. + Serial- and part number are used to identify a device.

param.desc: Part number of the peer device to be removed.
param.name: partNumber

param.desc: Serial number of the peer device to be removed.
param.name: serialNumber

function.name: addHTTPProfile
function.desc: Add a new HTTP profile to new or an already exiting device.

param.desc: Part number of the device that should be assigned to the profile.
param.name: partNumber

param.desc: Serial number of the device that should be assigned to the profile.
param.name: serialNumber

param.desc: HTTP profile designed as a crown datatype.
param.name: httpProfile

function.name: setMQTTMessageQueueSize
function.desc: Function to set the size of the MQTT message queue.

function.name: removeAllProfiles
function.desc: Remove all profiles and connected devices instead of the paired gateway device.

function.name: publishMQTTDataByID
function.desc: Publish MQTT data to the cloud using the device UUID

param.desc: MQTT topic where the data should be published to. + The topics are defined in the device profile.
param.name: topic

param.desc: Device UUID of the device to which the data is to be sent. + The UUID is returned by the function "addMQTTProfile".
param.name: deviceUUID

param.desc: JSON based payload to be published. + The payload is defined in the MQTT profile.
param.name: payload

function.name: setMQTTKeepAliveInterval
function.desc: MQTT keep alive interval.

function.name: setProcessInterval
function.desc: Reaction time to notice status changes of the LiveConnect connection.

function.name: setTokenTimeout
function.desc: Timeout for the accepting of the pairing token.

function.name: setDeviceDiscoveryTimeout
function.desc: Device discovery timeout.

function.name: setGatewaySerialNumber
function.desc: The serial number is automatically read out. If this is not possible, it can be set manually.

param.desc: Serial number of the gateway device.
param.name: serialNumber

function.name: getRegisteredProfiles
function.desc: Get a list of all registered devices and corresponding profiles.

return.desc: Assigned devices and profiles to the gateway device.
return.name: devices

function.name: setMQTTConnectTimeout
function.desc: MQTT connect timeout.

function.name: setMQTTMessageInterval
function.desc: MQTT message forwarding interval.

function.name: setGatewayPartNumber
function.desc: The part number is automatically read out. If this is not possible, it can be set manually.

param.desc: Part number of the gateway device.
param.name: partNumber

function.name: setCloudSystem
function.desc: Set cloud system that should be used. + The "dev" and "int" stage are only accessible in the SICK internal network.

function.name: getConnectionStatus
function.desc: Get LiveConnect connection status.

return.desc: Status: + - Online + - Execute command + - Discovery + - Pairing + - Offline
return.name: status

function.name: getDeviceURL
function.desc: Get device URL which refers to the digital twin on the SICK AssetHub.

return.desc: URL which refers to the digital twin on the SICK AssetHub.
return.name: url

function.name: removePairing
function.desc: Remove pairing between the phsical device and the digital twin in the SICK AssetHub.

function.name: setToken
function.desc: Set pairing token generated from the SICK AssetHub.

function.name: startTokenValidation
function.desc: Start token validation.

function.name: getValidateTokenResult
function.desc: Get validate token result.

function.name: getGatewayPartNumber
function.desc: Get part number of the gateway device itself.

return.desc: Part number of the gateway device.
return.name: partNumber

function.name: getGatewaySerialNumber
function.desc: Get serial number of the gateway device itself.

return.desc: Serial number of the gateway device.
return.name: serialNumber

event.name: OnNewStatusSystemClockConfigured
event.desc: Notify if system clock was configured.

event.name: OnNewStatusSystemClock
event.desc: Notify system clock status.

param.desc: Status (configured / not configured) and date / time in format [yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss] UTC).
param.name: status

event.name: OnNewStatusCurrentView
event.desc: Notify information about the information to be displayed on the UI page (UI only).

param.desc: 0 = Show pairing code and pair button. + 1 = Show device url and unpair button.
param.name: value

function.name: getCurrentView
function.desc: Provides information about the information to be displayed on the UI page (UI only).

return.desc: 0 = Show pairing code and pair button. + 1 = Show device url and unpair button.
return.name: value

function.name: getSystemClockStatus
function.desc: Get the status of the system clock (UI only).

return.desc: Status (configured / not configured) and date / time in format [yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss] UTC).
return.name: status

function.name: isSystemClockConfigured
function.desc: Indicates if the system clock is configured.

crown.name: MQTTProfile
crown.desc: MQTT profile definition. + Listed 'get'/'set' functions in API documentation relate to CROWN properties.

function.name: create
function.desc: Creates an object

param.desc: MQTT profile UUID with identifies the profile.
param.name: arg

return.desc: MQTT profile UUID with identifies the profile.
return.name: arg

param.desc: Must be unique if multiple profile instances are used per device.
param.name: arg

return.desc: Must be unique if multiple profile instances are used per device.
return.name: arg

return.desc: MQTT profile version in the format [X.X.X].
return.name: Version

param.desc: MQTT profile version in the format [X.X.X].
param.name: Version

return.desc: Content of the asyncAPI specification file.
return.name: AsyncAPISpecification

param.desc: Content of the asyncAPI specification file.
param.name: AsyncAPISpecification

crown.name: HTTPProfile
crown.desc: HTTP profile definition. + Listed 'get'/'set' functions in API documentation relate to CROWN properties.

function.name: create
function.desc: Creates an object

param.desc: HTTP profile UUID with identifies the profile.
param.name: arg

return.desc: HTTP profile UUID with identifies the profile.
return.name: arg

param.desc: Content of the openAPI specification file.
param.name: arg

return.desc: Content of the openAPI specification file.
return.name: arg

param.desc: HTTP profile version in the format [X.X.X].
param.name: arg

return.desc: HTTP profile version in the format [X.X.X].
return.name: arg

param.desc: HTTP profile service location without a leading or an ending "/".
param.name: arg

return.desc: HTTP profile service location without a leading or an ending "/".
return.name: arg

param.desc: HTTP endpoints provided by the profile.
param.name: arg

return.desc: HTTP endpoints provided by the profile.
return.name: arg

crown.name: Endpoint
crown.desc: HTTP endpoint that is offered by the HTTP profile. + Listed 'get'/'set' functions in API documentation relate to CROWN properties.

function.name: create
function.desc: Creates an object

param.desc: Relative URI of the HTTP endpoint without a leading "/".
param.name: arg

return.desc: Relative URI of the HTTP endpoint without a leading "/".
return.name: arg

param.desc: HTTP method that is allowed on this endpoint (GET, POST).
param.name: arg

return.desc: HTTP method that is allowed on this endpoint (GET, POST).
return.name: arg

param.desc: CROWN name of a function with parameter type is request and return value type is response.
param.name: arg

return.desc: CROWN name of a function with parameter type is request and return value type is response.
return.name: arg

crown.name: Response
crown.desc: HTTP response that should be sent to the LiveConnect server. + Listed 'get'/'set' functions in API documentation relate to CROWN properties.

function.name: create
function.desc: Creates an object

crown.name: Request
crown.desc: HTTP request that was received by the LiveConnect server. + Listed 'get'/'set' functions in API documentation relate to CROWN properties.

function.name: create
function.desc: Creates an object

return.desc: URL from the sender. Depending on the application, the URL contains REST parameter information.
return.name: u

param.desc: URL from the sender. Depending on the application, the URL contains REST parameter information.
param.name: u

crown.name: Header
crown.desc: Header information of a HTTP request / response. + Listed 'get'/'set' functions in API documentation relate to CROWN properties.

crown.name: Device
crown.desc: Assignment of profiles to a device. + Listed 'get'/'set' functions in API documentation relate to CROWN properties.

return.desc: Device UUID (see asset URL of the digital twin).
return.name: N

param.desc: Device UUID (see asset URL of the digital twin).
param.name: N
